titles.title: Marriage IRA Fairness Act of 2003
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to accelerate the scheduled increases in eligibility for individual retirement plans and to eliminate the marriage penalty in determining such eligibility.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 2/11/2003--Introduced. Marriage IRA Fairness Act of 2003 - Amends Internal Revenue Code provisions concerning retirement savings to: (1) increase, with respect to the limitation on the deduction for active participants in certain pension plans, the phaseout threshold to $50,000 (twice such amount on a joint return) and provide an annual cost-of-living adjustment; (2) increase the applicable dollar amount for a Roth IRA to $95,000 (twice such amount on a joint return); and (3) eliminate the marriage penalty on the IRA deduction for active pension plan participants.
